meanings.definition: Bad luck or an unfortunate event.
meanings.sent1: Her misfortune was losing her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: It was a misfortune that it rained on their picnic.
meanings.sent3: The misfortune of slipping on a banana peel made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The misfortune of missing the train felt like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The misfortune of getting a flat tire delayed their journey significantly.

meanings.definition: A condition of suffering or distress resulting from a mischance or an affliction.
meanings.sent1: The family faced financial misfortune after the unexpected medical bills.
meanings.sent2: She endured misfortune after losing her job and her home in the same month.
meanings.sent3: Despite the misfortune of burning the dinner, they ordered pizza and had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The misfortune of a broken heart can take time to heal.
meanings.sent5: The misfortune of failing the exam left him feeling defeated.
